com.intel.fightclub.cloud.logging

Class LogManagementUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.fightclub.cloud.logging.LogManagementUtil

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class LogManagementUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for managing large log files generated by the application.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentLogFile

        @Nullable
 @Slow(value=MILLISECONDS)
public static java.io.File getCurrentLogFile(@NonNull
                                                                                  java.io.File logFileTemplate,
                                                                                  long maxSizeKb,
                                                                                  int maxFiles,
                                                                                  boolean useLogManager)

        Checks existing log files that match given logFileTemplate and returns the latest one if maxSizeKb was not exceeded yet or creates a new log file. If the number of log files exceeds maxFiles, then the oldest log files are deleted until the number of log files is less than or equal to maxFiles.

        This is NOT a thread-safe method. The behavior is undefined if another thread is reading or writing to the file while this method is executed. Therefore, you must ensure proper synchronization on the file before executing this method.

        Additionally, this is not intra-process safe. If another process is manipulating the file, then undefined behavior may occur.

        Parameters:
        logFileTemplate - The template log file.
        maxSizeKb - The size threshold of a log file.
        maxFiles - The maximum number of log files in the parent directory of the log file template. If this number is exceeded, then the oldest log files are deleted.

      • scrubCsvText

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String scrubCsvText(@NonNull
                                                     java.lang.String text,
                                                     char delimiter)
        Scrubs the text bound for a CSV file so that invalid characters are properly handled. This does not validate that the text conforms to the CSV RFC; therefore, you should not pass in text that conforms to the RFC to this method.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to scrub.
        Returns:
        The scrubbed text.
